short_description: Computes the page rank for all pages in a web graph.
long_description: Computes the page rank for all pages in a web graph represented by two database tables. The assumption is that the function is provided input as follows: TABLE vertices (vertex keys, ...) TABLE edges (source vertex keys, target vertex keys, edge weight, ...). The function only supports edge weights. If EdgeWeight is not specified, PageRank takes the input as unweighted.

input_tables.name: vertices
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains vertices in the graph.
input_tables.description: The input table contains vertices in the graph.

input_tables.name: edges
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains edges in the graph.
input_tables.description: The input table contains edges in the graph.

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the target key columns in the edges table
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the target key columns in the edges table

argument_clauses.name: EdgeWeight
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the column in the edges table that contains the edge weight, which must be a positive value. By default, all edges have the same weight (that is, the graph is unweighted).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the column in the edges table that contains the edge weight, which must be a positive value. By default, all edges have the same weight (that is, the graph is unweighted).

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: DampFactor
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the value to use in the PageRank formula. The damp_factor must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.85.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the value to use in the PageRank formula. The damp_factor must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.85.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for which the algorithm runs before the function completes. The max_iterations must be a positive INTEGER value. The default value is 20. Note: max_iterations is the number of SQL-GR iterations (that is, the algorithm iterations shown in AMC minus 3).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for which the algorithm runs before the function completes. The max_iterations must be a positive INTEGER value. The default value is 20. Note: max_iterations is the number of SQL-GR iterations (that is, the algorithm iterations shown in AMC minus 3).

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the convergence criteria value. The threshold must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value. The default value is 0.0001.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the convergence criteria value. The threshold must be a DOUBLE PRECISION value. The default value is 0.0001.
